formalText: Sleeping well, she should say she doesn't want to sleep. Sleep brings Night Nurse with it and she has the same nightmare over and over.
She was wondering if she could get something to help her sleep and forget past events.
Yes, she would like to get my help because she feels like she can't live her life.
She's not wanting to be around groups of people.
She feels irritable and have been having trouble trouble concentrating and remembering things.
She doesn't have an appetite and feels nauseated a lot lately.
She's 28 years old and feels like an old lady.
She has had nightmares for years throughout her childhood.

And now she's 28 and still having them and never likes sleep and tries to avoid it and needs only about 5 hours a night. So anxious and irritable feelings have increased more in the last few months, she guesses.
She noticed her nausea and loss of appetite since the separation from her husband and since moving into her grandparents his house again.
She feels that she has less patience with her daughters and she also feels that she spaces out more. Having a hard time concentrating and sticking with tasks.
She finds herself wanting to go drive with the girls, you know, just get in the car and drive.
It just feels confining in the house all the time, but she doesn't want to be around Bunches of people.
She has always been mildly more sad than usual.
She guesses lately.
She feels like she is suffocating and like she needs space.
She wants to be alone.
She has not had feelings of suicide or homicide.
No. Suicide was a thought as she was growing up, but she can't leave her girls. When her parents divorced.
They're so in her grandparents house.
She had the panic attack and she doesn't feel entirely safe in the house.
She just figured she was not used to living on her own.
She's scared of something happening to her daughters and she will not be able to protect them.
She wake ups from her nightmares and feels and over and overwhelming sense that she can't protect them.
She goes checks on them after her heart slows and her shaking quits from The Nightmare.
The nightmares are mostly the same.
Someone is in the house chasing her and she needs to save her family before he gets to them and kills them all. They are dark dreams. Don't share with anyone outside of counseling.
She learned her dreams were not normal dreams when she was growing up.
Her friends would look petrified as she told them about the killing, chasing, and fear.
She wakes up in a sweat out of breath and her heart racing.
She done must get up and sit for a bit so she doesn't go back into the same dream.

She believes this all began with a panic attack. She thought she was having a heart issues but realize that she was having a panic attack. She just figured it was due to the split with her husband and moving back to her hometown and into the old house.
No medications and just basically talks about things that have happened in the past.
Sometimes she feels stuck and needs to talk to her counselor if that makes sense.
No. Suicide was a thought as she was growing up, but she can't leave her girls. When her parents divorced.
She wanted to die and later when they both remarried.
She's talked to her counselor about that to the suicide stuff.
She used to have a suicide plan when she was a teenager, she would take a bunch of pills or just get into her mom's car and turn it on and go to sleep in the close-up garage.
That was when she was in junior high and high school.
She couldn't leave her girls though.
She is interested in treatment options.
She smoked cigarettes a pack a day. Started when she quit alcohol.
She went through treatment for her drinking and has been sober for eight years.
No drug used.
Well, she has just moved back to town this last year with her two young daughters.
She's living at her grandparents house.
They have both passed.
She noticed after she moves and that she doesn't feel settled and she has the symptoms.
She just spoke of.
She loves her grandparents as a child.
She loves this house except for the basement.
She used to have to play with her cousin the basement.
He was not a nice person. Five years older than her and likes to teach her all sorts of things sexual things.
She was only five at the time and didn't understand.
She felt dirty and ashamed. She didn't tell anyone until she was an adult.
She's gone to counseling for this as an adult.
No one else knows.
Her family does not know about this abuse from her cousin.
She told the counselor once. She can't tell them because it would all because all it would do is cause pain for the family.
It's over and done and she just wants to move on with her life.
She has just separated from her husband and wants to move on with her life.
Her husband was emotionally and mentally abusive. Not always but they just couldn't seem to work things out.
She grew up with her step dad abusing my mom.
So she recognizes the cycle and she didn't want to get to the physical abuse stage.
Just her cousin has sexually or physically abused her.
Her mom was pretty physical.
She would get beat then ask kids would get beat.
It was just messed up.
She is on my own now and away from all of that.
Her children have not been exposed to any of uses.
She makes sure that they are not left with anyone other than her sister and her grandmother when she was alive.
They don't have sleepovers and they know about Good and Bad Touch.
Her daughters are 5 + 1 is 7. They are good girls.
She thinks the ages of her daughters probably trigger some of her memories.
Probably. They are so small and innocent.
She can't go there.
Her mom was a yeller and through things she cursed a lot and was not a happy person.
She had her when she was 16.
So they always kind of clashed.
Her husband was also a yeller and controller. He means to protect her, but it goes too far.
She worries about her daughter's being harmed.
Like she was she also worried about how the separation with her husband will affect them.
But her parents divorced it was devastating to her.
Her life just went downhill.
Her Mom married an alcoholic that beat her and then she beat them. The cops were at their house a lot to break up the fighting.
It was embarrassing.
They didn't eat well or often and she usually cooked for her sister and brother because her mom and stepdad were at the bar.
They ate a lot of Pancakes.
It was all she knew how to cook at 9 years old in the batteries cheap.
She missed her dad.
He never raised his voice or hit her one.
He was the opposite of her stepdad.
They moved every year.
She was in school sometimes across the street or sometimes across town.
She got behind in school because of changing so many times and she learned to not get too close to friends.
Her mom was depressed and has issues.
She's never been treated.
Her dad is fine.
No problems.
No other medical issues that she knows of.
Sleeping well, she should say, she doesn't want to sleep. Sleep brings Night Nurse with it and she has the same nightmare over and over.
She was wondering if she could get something to help her sleep and forget past events.
5 hours of sleep is her average she says. She does not nap during the day.
No, not to bring on very bad dreams some of the worst.
She avoids napping.
She also works at an insurance office and doesn't have time to sleep more than she does.
